block.p: Brenda Lee Essex and Walter Arnett Doyle Jr. were married yesterday at the Bath and Tennis Club in Palm Beach, Fla. The Rev. Mary Moore Gaines, an Episcopal priest, performed the ceremony.

The bride, 32, is known as Lee and will continue to use her surname professionally. She is a painter. She graduated from Roanoke College and also studied at the New York Studio School. She is a daughter of Brenda T. Callaway of Palm Beach and Winfield Scott Essex Jr. of Kilmacthomas, Ireland. The bride's father manages a hedge fund for Buttonwood Holdings in Dublin. A former safari hunter, he is also an honorary member of the East African Professional Hunters Association, an organization in Kenya that governs big game hunting. She is a granddaughter of the late Walter C. Teagle Jr., a president of Standard Oil.
Brenda Lee Essex and Walter Arnett Doyle Jr. were married yesterday at the Bath and Tennis Club in Palm Beach, Fla. The Rev. Mary Moore Gaines, an Episcopal priest, performed the ceremony.

The bride, 32, is known as Lee and will continue to use her surname professionally. She is a painter. She graduated from Roanoke College and also studied at the New York Studio School. She is a daughter of Brenda T. Callaway of Palm Beach and Winfield Scott Essex Jr. of Kilmacthomas, Ireland. The bride's father manages a hedge fund for Buttonwood Holdings in Dublin. A former safari hunter, he is also an honorary member of the East African Professional Hunters Association, an organization in Kenya that governs big game hunting. She is a granddaughter of the late Walter C. Teagle Jr., a president of Standard Oil.

The bridegroom, 32, is a vice president for business development in the San Francisco office of Net2Phone, an Internet telephone company. He graduated from Emory University and is the son of Betty Ann Mead of Beaufort, S.C., and the late Dr. Doyle. His mother is a former director of the South Carolina Humanities Council, an arts organization. His father was a pediatric dentist and orthodontist in Lexington, Ky. The bridegroom is the stepson of Stephen Mead, who retired as the president of North East Properties, a commercial real estate development company in Boston.
